column1: Do you have a persistent cough lasting more than 2 weeks?
column2: Are you coughing up blood or blood-stained sputum?
column3: Do you experience night sweats regularly?
column4: Have you had an unexplained weight loss recently?
column5: Do you have a prolonged fever or fatigue?
column6: Have you been in close contact with a person who has TB?
column7: Have you previously been treated for TB?
column8: Have you traveled or lived in a region with high TB prevalence?
column10: Are you undergoing immune-suppressive treatment (e.g. cancer therapy)?
column12: Do you have chronic illnesses such as diabetes?
column13: Do you have a cough with mucus or phlegm?
column14: Are you experiencing chest pain when breathing or coughing?
column15: Do you have a high fever, chills, or sweating?
column16: Are you experiencing shortness of breath?
column17: Do you feel unusually fatigued or weak?
column18: Have you recently had a respiratory infection (like flu or cold)?
column19: Do you have asthma or COPD?
column20: Are you immunocompromised (e.g. HIV, chemo, steroids)?
column21: Do you smoke or have a smoking history?
column22: Are you a child below 5 or an adult over 65?
column23: Do you have any chronic heart or lung diseases?
column24: Have you received pneumococcal or flu vaccinations?
column25: Do you have a persistent cough that doesn’t go away?
column26: Are you coughing up blood or rust-colored sputum?
column27: Do you experience hoarseness or wheezing?
column28: Do you have chest pain that worsens with deep breaths?
column29: Have you experienced significant weight loss or fatigue recently?
column30: Do you currently smoke or have a history of smoking?
column31: Are you frequently exposed to secondhand smoke, asbestos, or radon?
column32: Do you have a family history of lung cancer?
column33: Have you been exposed to occupational hazards (e.g. mining, construction)?
column34: Have you previously had radiation therapy to the chest?
column35: Do you have any chronic lung diseases (e.g. COPD, TB scars)?
